author: The Leader staff
title: Whitney, Hoad lift Hammondsport volleyball
text: Whitney, Hoad lift Hammondsport volleyball Comment Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 9:37 PM By The Leader staff Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 9:37 PM HAMMONDSPORT | Tanessa Whitney’s 14 kills and 17 setter assists Wednesday helped the Hammondsport volleyball team to a hard-fought 16-25, 25-22, 15-25, 25-19, 25-16 match win against Campbell-Savona. Trehana Hoad added 14 kills and 12 setter assists for the Lakers, while teammate Edda Martinez led the way at the service line with five aces. Katie Page led Campbell-Savona with 10 aces and Corinne Smith finished with eight kills and one ace for the Panthers. Hannah Scott finished with 11 setter assists and three aces for Campbell-Savona. Hammondsport (10-3) will host Canisteo-Greenwood at 6:30 p.m. Thursday. Volleyball Bath 3, Hornell 0 HORNELL | Bath topped Hornell in three games Wednesday. The Rams won with scores of 25-14, 25-12 and 25-17. Bath was led by five kills and seven digs from Hannah Gelder. Kyara Wilson and Jessica Hillman were strong from the service line with six aces and five aces, respectively. Justyna Seager-Parulski chipped in with eight assists. Hornell was led by five digs and an ace from Carrie Connor and two aces from Kathryn Harrick. Bath will play Dansville on Friday. Girls Soccer SCAA Arkport 6, Bradford 0 BRADFORD | Brooke Geibel’s two goals and two assists Wednesday paced Arkport in a 6-0 shutout of Bradford. Olivia Chatain also netted two goals for the Blue Jays, who opened up a 3-0 lead at halftime. Makenzie McDaniel made four saves in goal for Arkport. Bradford’s Destiny Decker made 25 saves in goal. Bradford (2-11-1) will host Campbell-Savona at 4:30 p.m. Friday. Boys Soccer SCAA Alfred-Almond 3, Prattsburgh 0 PRATTSBURGH | Jake Johnston scored a pair of goals Wednesday to guide Alfred-Almond to a 3-0 win against Prattsburgh. The Eagles also got a goal from Cory Olix, while teammate Noah Holmok dished out two assists. Alfred-Almond’s Dylan Griffin turned back three shots to earn the shutout. Prattsburgh’s Enoch Anderson made 12 saves in goal. Prattsburgh (8-7) will play at Arkport at 6:30 p.m. Friday to close the regular season. Boys Soccer Bath Haverling 4, Dansville 0 Dansville 0 0 -- 0 Dansville: No scoring. Bath (10-4-1): Andres Warren 2-0, Connor Strong 1-1, Elliott Hillman 1-0, Casey Hyer 0-2. Shots on goal: D 9, B 21. Corner kicks: D 3, B 4. Saves: D -- Ryan Conklin 13, B -- Steven Binkowski 4. SCAA
